title: Generative Adversarial Networks vs Large Language Models: A Comparative Study on Synthetic Tabular Data Generation
author: Austin A. Barr (Cumming School of Medicine, University of Calgary), Robert Rozman (Independent Researcher), Eddie Guo (Cumming School of Medicine, University of Calgary), ...
relevance_why: The study explores the efficacy of Large Language Models for generating synthetic tabular data, which can inform approaches in data augmentation and generative modeling for audio-related datasets.
background: The paper examines the ability of Large Language Models to generate realistic synthetic tabular data without needing real-world data or fine-tuning.
contribution: This paper introduces the potential of Large Language Models for generating synthetic tabular data in a zero-shot setting, achieving high fidelity and privacy preservation compared to traditional Generative Adversarial Networks.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Generative Adversarial Networks require access to real-world data for training, often increasing privacy risks.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work showcases that Large Language Models can generate high-quality synthetic data without prior exposure to real datasets, utilizing simple prompts effectively.

key_innovation: Demonstrates that a Large Language Model can generate synthetic data that maintains statistical properties of real-world data using only natural language instructions.
real_world_impact: If adopted widely, this method could streamline the generation of synthetic datasets across various domains, encouraging broader sharing of data while maintaining privacy.
limitations: The authors acknowledge limitations in the preservation of distributional characteristics and the need for refinement in data fidelity.

new_terms.zero-shot generation: **Zero-shot generation** refers to the capability of a model to generate outputs for tasks it has not been explicitly trained on, using only descriptive prompts.
new_terms.conditional tabular generative adversari: **CTGAN** is a specialized variant of Generative Adversarial Networks designed specifically for generating tabular data by conditioning on class labels.

open_sourcing: All generated datasets can be accessed at the GitHub repository provided in the paper.
